newsitem.title: UK: LIFFE white sugar ends firmer after late jump.
newsitem.headline: LIFFE white sugar ends firmer after late jump.

text.p: Nearby white sugar futures popped higher just before the close on Tuesday, extending the day's gains.
"There was a bit of technical buying by the funds and trade buying behind it," one trader said.
Most active May finished $3.60 higher at $307.30 per tonne, just 20 cents off its high. August ended $2.10 firmer at $306.00, also 20 cents off its peak.
Earlier, bullish sentiment in New York spilled over into the London market. Outright purchases from trade players triggered some May/August buying, but scale sellers moved in.
In Paris, both May and August closed 90 cents up at the same price of $306.90.
